title: 'Lost control but ... ': Hasina's first reaction after Bangladesh court sentences her to death
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina has defied a death sentence for "crimes against humanity," calling the International Crimes Tribunal's ruling politically motivated. She claims the August 2024 student protests, which led to her government's fall, were not a premeditated assault. Hasina insists on facing charges in a legitimate court, highlighting her government's human rights achievements and economic growth.

title: Saudi bus crash: Death toll rises to 45; CM announces ex-gratia of Rs 5L
content: A devastating bus fire near Medina in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of 45 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana, with only one survivor. The blaze spread rapidly, preventing most passengers from escaping the tragedy. This incident marks one of the most severe overseas accidents involving pilgrims from the state in recent years.

title: India-US trade deal soon? First tranche near closure! Would be 'highly detailed'
content: India and the US are nearing a trade deal, addressing reciprocal and oil tariffs. Discussions are underway to finalize a package including US market access and tariff adjustments. Officials indicate negotiations are largely complete, with a resolution expected soon.

title: Pakistan camp goes berserk after beating India A; clip goes viral – Watch
content: Mohammad Faiq and Maaz Sadaqat — who finished unbeaten and carried Pakistan home — were visibly fired up as they headed back to the dugout. High-fives, roars and bear hugs followed as the players celebrated the emphatic result.

title: Why a cat's death has 'shaken' San Francisco and is troubling Google?
content: A beloved neighborhood cat, Kit Kat, was tragically killed by a Waymo robotaxi in San Francisco, sparking public outrage and calls for greater local control over autonomous vehicles.  Residents are demanding accountability, highlighting the lack of human responsibility in such incidents. Waymo expressed condolences, stating the cat darted under their vehicle.

title: IPL captaincy: 'Giving reviews to owners' - KL Rahul reveals toughest part
content: Indian cricketer KL Rahul finds IPL captaincy more taxing than international duty, citing extensive meetings and ownership reviews. The Indian batter revealed that the constant questioning from owners, often lacking cricket insight, leaves him mentally and physically drained post-tournament. Rahul, now a player for Delhi Capitals, has stepped down from captaincy.

title: 'Shoe bomber' in Delhi? NIA probes terrifying new angle in Red Fort blast
content: Investigators are exploring a chilling possibility in the recent Red Fort suicide bombing: the attacker may have used a shoe bomb. A recovered shoe with a metallic component, potentially a trigger, and the suspected use of TATP explosive, echo the infamous 2001 shoe bomb attempt. This sophisticated attack, linked to a module of radicalised doctors, has left agencies stunned.

title: Cognizant 'tracking' what employees do on their laptops, the purpose is to…
content: IT giant Cognizant is reportedly training executives on ProHance, a tool that monitors employee laptop activity and application usage for micro-level productivity tracking. The system records mouse and keyboard input to gauge engagement, marking employees as 'idle' or 'away from system' after specific inactivity periods. While Cognizant states the data won't impact individual performance reviews, focusing instead on project efficiency and client demands for billable hours, employee concerns about micromanagement persist.

title: 'Crimes against humanity': Bangladesh's ousted PM Hasina sentenced to death; key takeaways
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been convicted of crimes against humanity by the International Crimes Tribunal for her role in the violent crackdown on student protests. The unrest led to the collapse of her government, with Hasina now living in exile in India. The verdict follows months of hearings, with prosecutors labeling her the "mastermind" behind the attacks.

title: First win in 15yrs! Bavuma's 'jump and punch' celebration against India goes viral - Watch
content: After the victory, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma’s wild celebrations were captured in a video circulating on social media. He leapt in the air, punched his fists with delight, and embraced head coach Shukri Conrad.

title: Al-Falah University and the cracks in India’s accreditation system
content: A terror investigation into the 10 November Red Fort blast has unexpectedly exposed major flaws in India’s accreditation system. As Al-Falah University came under scrutiny, NAAC, AIU and Delhi Police simultaneously flagged alleged fake accreditation claims, triggering notices, suspensions and FIRs. The episode reveals how easily institutions can project legitimacy—and how slowly regulators act until a crisis forces intervention.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
content: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.

title: 'Adolescence' to 'The Death of Bunny Monroe': Child-centric adult dramas topping global charts
content: Global dramas like 'Adolescence' and 'The Death of Bunny Monroe' are centering child actors in complex adult narratives, a trend starkly absent in India. This contrasts with the Kerala State Film Awards' decision to not honour child actors, sparking debate about their role in Indian cinema.

title: Furious Dana White bans Dillon Danis for life after UFC 322 chaos
content: Following a chaotic crowd brawl at UFC 322, Dana White has banned Dillon Danis from all future UFC events. The incident, involving Danis and members of Islam Makhachev's team, overshadowed the main card. White acknowledged his miscalculation in allowing Danis near Makhachev's entourage, citing Danis' long-standing feud with Khabib Nurmagomedov's associates.

title: Shatrughan Sinha and wife Poonam visit to check on Dharmendra's health
content: Shatrughan Sinha and wife Poonam visited Hema Malini to check on Dharmendra’s health after his hospital discharge. On Monday, Shatrughan shared photos and a heartfelt message from the visit. Dharmendra recovered at home post-treatment, with family requesting privacy. He and Shatrughan have also acted together in several notable Bollywood films.

title: 'Big achievement': Afridi drags in Pak's victory over India A; remarks after SL win go viral
content: Pakistan's ODI team clinched a dominant 3-0 series win against Sri Lanka, a victory amplified by Pakistan Shaheens' triumph over India A in the Asia Cup Rising Stars. Captain Shaheen Afridi lauded both achievements, highlighting the team's confidence and the impressive comeback of Mohammad Wasim Jr. after injury. The Shaheens' chase was spearheaded by Maaz Sadaqat's explosive 79.

title: 'If Pak gives us an opportunity …': Army chief’s warning after Delhi blast; calls Op Sindoor a 'trailer'
content: Army chief has issued a stern warning to Pakistan and terror groups, stating that the recent Operation Sindoor was merely a preview of India's capabilities. He emphasized that India will retaliate against both terrorists and their state sponsors, asserting that the nation is prepared for future challenges and will not be intimidated.

title: Mecca–Medina tragedy: Govt releases list of 45 passengers; Hyderabad families await updates
content: A tragic road accident in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of over 40 Indian Umrah pilgrims, all reportedly from Hyderabad. A passenger bus carrying pilgrims from Mecca to Medina collided with a diesel tanker, with many victims believed to have been asleep at the time. Authorities are working to identify all deceased and provide assistance to affected families.

title: 'Bihar approves Gobi farming': Assam min’s post sparks row for ‘alluding to 1989 Bhagalpur riots’
content: Assam minister Ashok Singhal's post on "gobi farming" after Bihar poll results has sparked outrage from the Congress. The opposition alleges the imagery alludes to the 1989 Bhagalpur violence, where victims were reportedly hidden under cauliflower plantations. Congress leaders condemned the remark as "vulgar and shameful."

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal dips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices retreated on Monday following hawkish remarks from US Federal Reserve officials, dampening hopes of an imminent rate cut. This sentiment shift pulled bullion prices lower after a strong rally last week. Traders are now awaiting crucial US economic data, particularly the non-farm payrolls report, for further policy cues.

title: Bihar results: Almost equal vote share for Owaisi’s AIMIM and NOTA
content: In Bihar's recent assembly elections, Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM and NOTA secured nearly identical vote shares, polling 1.85% and 1.81% respectively. Experts suggest this parity reflects voter disenchantment with mainstream parties, while the decline of traditional parties like CPI also warrants closer examination.

title: NHL Injury Update: Charlie McAvoy out after slapshot in the Montreal Canadiens
content: Boston Bruins star defenseman Charlie McAvoy suffered a facial injury after a slapshot during Saturday's game. He was seen being helped off the ice and is currently undergoing tests. His return for upcoming games remains uncertain, causing concern for fans and the team. Updates on his condition are eagerly awaited.

title: India needs 86 million higher education enrolments by 2035 to meet NEP goals: Report
content: India’s higher education sector faces an unprecedented expansion push, with a new report warning that achieving the NEP 2020 goal of a 50 percent GER will require 86.11 million enrolments by 2035. As traditional campuses strain under capacity and skill demands shift rapidly, the report urges digital ecosystems, flexible learning, and quality-focused reforms to prevent India’s demographic advantage from eroding.

title: 'Have faith in Shami': Ganguly's message to Gambhir after Eden shocker
content: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sourav Ganguly reiterated his call for Mohammed Shami's Test comeback, emphasising the need to trust proven pacers like Bumrah, Siraj, and Shami. Ganguly also urged coach Gautam Gambhir to prepare better wickets, stating Team India needs solid batting foundations to win Test matches.

title: ‘Hubby’s innocent’: Blood-written message on floor was UP man’s last bluff after killing wife
content: In a shocking twist in Prayagraj, a husband attempted to mask his wife's murder as a suicide. He penned a fabricated confession using her blood, but investigators quickly spotted the red flags—there simply wasn't enough blood for the message.

title: Who is Rameez Nemat Khan? 'Outsider' behind Lalu family’s turmoil; ex-cricketer faces 12 criminal cases
content: RJD chief Lalu Prasad's daughter Rohini Acharya blamed "outsiders" for the party's electoral defeat, pointing to former cricketer Rameez Nemat Khan and RJD MP Sanjay Yadav. Khan, son-in-law of jailed politician Rizwan Zaheer, faces multiple criminal cases, including murder and Gangsters Act charges, despite being granted bail in several instances.

title: Inflation at record low! Will your loan EMIs come down further? Explained
content: Retail inflation in October has hit its lowest level since 2013 - the time that this series of CPI inflation started. At the start of 2025, the repo rate stood at 6.5% - and as the end of the year approaches, it has come down by a full 100 basis points! Where will the easing cycle stop? Will RBI wait for more clarity on the India-US trade deal, or is time ripe for another rate cut?

title: Lalu pari-war: After Rohini, 3 more daughters walk out of Patna home
content: A bitter family feud has erupted within Lalu Prasad's family, with daughter Rohini Acharya alleging humiliation and abuse from her brother Tejashwi Yadav and his associates after donating a kidney to her father. The fallout intensified as three more sisters left their parents' home, while Tej Pratap Yadav voiced support for Rohini, accusing 'betrayers' of targeting the family.

title: 'We are not the best players of spin': R Ashwin slams India's Eden collapse
content: Ravichandran Ashwin criticises India's batting collapse against South Africa, stating the current generation struggles against spin. He believes past Indian batters would have handled the turning track better, attributing the decline to insufficient practice. Ashwin argues Western teams now outperform India against spin due to dedicated preparation, a stark contrast to India's improved overseas pace bowling.

title: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM: Oath ceremony on Nov 20
content: Nitish Kumar resigned as Bihar chief minister, paving the way for his 10th term. The NDA government, securing a strong majority in the recent elections, will see Kumar sworn in on Thursday, November 20. The new cabinet will include JD(U), BJP, and smaller allies, with seat allocations finalized.

title: As America tightens H1B curbs, are Indians losing out or finally gaining an edge?
content: As the US tightens H-1B visa rules and raises costs sharply, the long-assumed arc of Indian engineering ambition is being challenged. Yet early signals from IIT campuses and industry suggest a surprising shift: instead of anxiety, India’s talent pool is turning inward with new confidence, driven by booming GCCs, rising startups, and a sense that opportunity no longer requires a Westward leap.

title: India seals first LPG pact with US; 2.2 MTPA deal to meet 10% of total import needs
content: India has finalized its first one-year structured agreement to import approximately 2.2 million tonnes per annum of LPG from the US Gulf Coast. This historic deal, set for 2026, diversifies India's energy supply chain and marks a significant step in securing stable and affordable LPG for households, including Ujjwala beneficiaries.

title: IPL 2026: RR reboot! Sangakkara back as head coach; replaces Dravid after tough season
content: Rajasthan Royals have appointed Kumar Sangakkara as their head coach for IPL 2026, alongside his Director of Cricket role. This move follows a disappointing 2025 season under Rahul Dravid. Sangakkara, who previously led the team to the 2022 final, aims to bring stability and renewed competitiveness with a strengthened coaching staff.

title: 'Starmer out': Thousands protest over govt plan to house asylum seekers
content: Around 2,000 people protested in Crowborough against plans to house 540 single male asylum seekers at a disused army camp. Concerns over safety, local services, and an "information vacuum" fueled community tension, with some residents installing panic alarms. The Home Office stated security checks and behavioral expectations will be enforced.

title: 5-year-old boy falls to death from 22nd-floor in Gurgaon
content: A tragic incident unfolded in Gurgaon's Sector 62 where a five-year-old boy, Rudra Tej Singh, fell to his death from the 22nd floor of Pioneer Presidia Society. While returning with his nanny, the boy inadvertently locked himself out of their apartment. He then climbed onto a clothes rack on the balcony seeking help, but lost his balance and fell.

title: Mecca-Medina bus crash: Control room set up in Jeddah - here are the helpline numbers
content: A tragic bus accident near Medina, Saudi Arabia, claimed the lives of 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims, many believed to be from Hyderabad. The bus collided with a diesel tanker while traveling from Mecca. Indian authorities have released emergency helpline numbers and established control rooms to assist affected families.

title: Trump warns countries trading with Russia on oil; backs 500% tariff
content: US President Donald Trump supports new sanctions targeting Russia. Countries trading with Moscow could face severe penalties. Iran may also be included. Senators are proposing even stronger measures, including tariffs on oil purchases. These actions aim to pressure nations supporting Russia's actions in Ukraine. The goal is to isolate Russia economically and end the conflict.

title: Over 40 Indians feared dead in Saudi: Medina-bound bus collides with diesel tanker
content: More than 40 Indian Umrah pilgrims, many from Hyderabad, are feared dead after a bus collided with a diesel tanker in Saudi Arabia early Monday. The bus was travelling from Mecca to Medina when the crash occurred. 24x7 helpline.Helpline (toll free): 8002440003 (Toll free), 0122614093, 0126614276, 0556122301 (WhatsApp)

title: Delhi records best November 1–15 air quality in 3 years — still not worth inhaling
content: Delhi experienced its lowest average AQI in three years during the first fortnight of November, registering at 348. This improvement, despite remaining in the 'very poor' category, is attributed to an early Diwali, reduced stubble burning, better weather, and water sprinkling near monitoring stations.

title: Will gold be under pressure in the coming days? Why Rs 1,22,000 is an important level
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to face pressure this week due to global factors, including shifting Federal Reserve rate cut expectations and weak US economic indicators. While some data initially supported bullion, a firmer dollar and subdued Asian demand are likely to weigh on prices.

title: IND vs SA—'Defence becomes last priority': Ex-India cricketer's blunt warning
content: India's recent Test defeat to South Africa highlights a decline in defensive batting, according to former batter Sanjay Manjrekar. He believes the dominance of T20s and leagues has made Test cricket the least favoured format, diminishing players' ability to block out quality spells. Manjrekar suggests a shift in pitch philosophy, advocating for English-style pitches to revive competitive Test cricket.

title: French consulate staffer molested while walking home in Bandra
content: A 27-year-old French individual became the victim of an alarming molestation incident by a scooter rider on the streets of Bandra West. On November 8th, the unfortunate event spurred a police investigation that culminated in the arrest of 25-year-old Sunil Waghela, a trader from Dharavi.

title: From Gukesh to R Pragg: Early WC exits expose harsh truths
content: Russian Grandmaster Daniil Dubov's dismissive comments after defeating R Praggnanandhaa highlight a trend of early exits for elite players at the FIDE World Cup 2025. Several top seeds, including World Champion D Gukesh, fell to lower-rated opponents, prompting discussions about the narrowing gap in skill and flaws in the rating system.

title: How interstellar objects reach Earth and where they are most likely to land
content: New simulations reveal interstellar objects don't arrive uniformly, with concentrations from the solar apex and galactic plane. Earth's orbital motion creates seasonal impact patterns, peaking in Northern Hemisphere winter. Most impacts are predicted near the equator, with a slight Northern Hemisphere bias due to orbital geometry and the Sun's influence.

title: Sanders rues 'rough' debut after Gabriel concussed
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders made his NFL debut Sunday against the Ravens, coming on after fellow rookie Dillon Gabriel was concussed.

title: Source: Concern Rodgers has break in left wrist
content: The initial concern is that Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has "a slight break" in his left wrist, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Eagles D shuts down Goff, Lions in statement win
content: The Eagles "made a statement on defense" Sunday night, shutting down quarterback Jared Goff and the normally high-powered Lions attack in a 16-9 win that swings the conference odds in Philly's favor.

title: Mahomes takes blame as division title hopes fade
content: Patrick Mahomes took much of the blame for the Chiefs' 22-19 loss to the Broncos, an outcome that leveled the team's record at 5-5 and put their hopes at winning another AFC West title in doubt.

title: Draymond confronts fan over 'Angel Reese' chant
content: Draymond Green went nearly chest-to-chest with a fan during the Warriors' road game against the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night.

title: Sources: Naylor, Mariners reunite on 5-year deal
content: First baseman Josh Naylor and the Mariners are in agreement on a five-year contract, sources told ESPN, reuniting one of the best free agent bats available with the team that made re-signing him its top offseason priority.

title: Allen's 6 TDs draw more 'unreal' praise by Bills
content: Josh Allen rebounded from a rough start against the Buccaneers to record three passing touchdowns and a career-high three rushing TDs. It was his second career game with 3 TDs passing and 3 rushing.

title: What do Week 11 games mean for the rest of the season? We hit big questions, key stats and QB breakouts
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 11.

title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: From Josh McDaniels to Dan Campbell: What has gone right, wrong for every NFL OC, playcaller this season
content: NFL Nation reporters break down the good and bad for each OC/playcaller and peg the key to success the rest of the season.

title: 30 NBA teams, seven tiers, one clear title favorite: How the league stacks up
content: ESPN's Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton sort NBA teams into seven tiers based on outlook for success at the end of the regular season and beyond.

title: The NHL's best this week: How the Devils move forward minus Jack Hughes
content: One of the game's elite players will be out eight weeks for a division leader. Plus, a look at the week's key games.

title: 'I'm probably going to cry': Inside DeMarvion Overshown's long journey back from knee surgery
content: Overshown's breakout 2024 season for Dallas was cut short by a horrendous knee injury. Here's how he fought his way back.

title: Raiders offense was meant to make strides under Kelly, but the opposite has occurred
content: From national champion and Pro Bowler to ... league-worst offense? What's next for Chip Kelly and Geno Smith.

title: Players react to NFL's efforts to halt team report cards: 'Fact that there's pushback shows it's working'
content: NFL players who spoke to ESPN say the report cards are making a tangible impact on workplace conditions.

title: Week 11 winners and losers: Allen, McCaffrey dominate; Chase, Jefferson go quiet
content: Josh Allen, Christian McCaffrey and Sean Tucker led the way with big Week 11 performances, while Ja'Marr Chase, Justin Jefferson and Lamar Jackson were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Tucker goes off for Buccaneers; Packers lose Jacobs, Ridley's season over
content: Sean Tucker had 140 yards and three TDs in early Sunday action, but injuries abounded again in Week 11.

title: From multiple A-pluses to ... a whole lot of F's: Grading bold season predictions for all 30 MLB teams
content: It's time to see if what we said about each club going into the season was accurate or not -- and what it means for 2026.

title: Orlando's NWSL title defense is over, so what's next for Marta?
content: Marta was the best player on the field Sunday, but it wasn't enough to inspire Orlando past Gotham FC.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot in 27 years and became one of Europe's best
content: Norway have players like Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard but haven't made a World Cup since 1998. Now they have, and it's taken some change.

title: Ukraine keep World Cup hopes alive with clinched playoff spot
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it looks around the globe.

title: Draft risers, questions and notes: How does this WR class stack up?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 12, including why Zachariah Branch and Makai Lemon are intriguing prospects.

title: Modern classics: 25 of the best kits from the 21st century
content: As we approach the end of 2025, we've assembled 25 of the best original kit designs worn by top clubs from around the world since the year 2000.

title: Arsenal, Bayern, Marseille? Lessons learned across Europe's top leagues after 10 games
content: With nearly three months of games being played across the continent, what has stuck out the most from the major European leagues?

title: Grant breezes to second LPGA title at The Annika
content: Linn Grant closed with a 5-under 65 on Sunday for a three-shot victory over Jennifer Kupcho in The Annika. It was Grant's second LPGA title, and the second time she received a trophy from Swedish great and tournament host Annika Sorenstam.

title: What's next for Makhachev, Shevchenko and other stars from UFC 322?
content: Brett Okamoto breaks down the options for Islam Makhachev, Valentina Shevchenko, and more after UFC 322.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Grimaldo amid major changes to squad
content: Barcelona are looking for reinforcements at left back, right back and on the wing. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: I&B Ministry approves 26% increase in rates for advertisements in print media
content: The government has also agreed to the recommendations of the Committee relating to premium rates to be offered for colour advertisements, and preferential positioning, the Ministry said

title: ECI orders ‘Special Revision’ of voter list in Assam
content: According to instructions issued by the poll authority for the chief electoral officer of Assam, January 1, 2026 will be the qualifying date for the state to carry out the Special Revision.

title: Increase enrolment fees for law graduates, Bar Council co-chairman urges Centre
content: Insists that the Advocates Act of 1961 must be amended in the forthcoming winter session of Parliament

title: Bangladesh urges Indian government to hand over Hasina, former Minister Kamal
content: Indian government said in a statement it “will always engage constructively with all stakeholders considering best interests of people of Bangladesh.”

title: A. Vellayan, former chairman of Murugappa Group, passes away at 72
content: Mr. Vellayan had served on the boards of various companies in Murugappa Group, including as Chairman of Coromandel International Ltd. and EID Parry Ltd.

title: Opposition to Karnataka government’s move to deploy PU lecturers to teach high school students
content: Department of School Education and Literacy (DSEL) has decided to amend the ‘Karnataka General Services (Pre-University Education) (Recruitment) Rules 2013’

title: BPCL contract tanker drivers launch flash strike in Kerala
content: Over 250 fuel tank drivers who have gone on strike demand immediate implementation of favourable terms

title: Bal Thackeray death anniversary: Uddhav, Raj put up united front at Shivaji Park memorial
content: Thackeray cousins, once arch rivals, have warmed up to each other ahead of local body polls and have given enough hints of forming an alliance, but have yet to announce it, says sources

title: Assam bans movement of pigs to check spread of African swine fever
content: Animal husbandry and veterinary officials have identified 297 epicentres of the contagious and lethal disease across almost all 35 districts in the State

title: Cold wave alert in five Telangana districts on November 18
content: Hyderabad and its surrounding areas for the next 24 hours will see mist or hazy conditions during mornings and nights

title: Teppotsavam at Patalaganga postponed
content: The Srisailam temple authorities decided against conducting the ritual in Krishna river as the Srisailam Dam authorities indicated that the water levels are likely to change

title: Karnataka to unveil State-developed AI-ready personal computer KEO at Bengaluru Tech Summit 2025
content: KEO, which stands for Knowledge-driven, Economical, Open-source, aims to make intelligent computing accessible at the grassroots and empower citizens across Karnataka, officials said

title: Government approves 17 projects with ₹7,172 crore investment under electronics component manufacturing scheme
content: “To achieve long-term success, India will have to focus on building design teams, ensuring Six Sigma Quality standards in all products, and partnering with 'Swadeshi' suppliers in projects,” says the Minister for Electronics and IT

title: Kerala BLOs stage Statewide protests demanding postponement of SIR by ECI
content: Police block marches taken out to office of Chief Electoral Officer outside Kerala Legislative Assembly

title: ‘I told them not to go together’: Hyderabad families shattered as 45 pilgrims die in Saudi bus accident
content: Family members of the lone survivor, as well as of those killed in the crash, recall the final moments and the aftermath of the tragedy

title: Avadi woman killed as husband reverses car into her
content: While reversing the car, the husband pressed the accelerator by mistake, and it crashed into a wall after hitting the woman, who was caught between the vehicle and a wall

title: Amid protests over work pressure, anganwadi teacher on BLO duty collapses during SIR in Kerala
content: N. Sreeja (45), a BLO in Kanhangad Assembly constituency, reportedly fell ill and collapsed while carrying out SIR work at a house. She was rushed to a private hospital in Konnakkad where she is undergoing treatment

title: Saudi Arabia bus accident: 18 members of a Hyderabad family killed; 5 from another family
content: The Telangana State Haj Committee said it has no jurisdiction over private tour operators, but would extend assistance to the family of the victims

title: IUML leader P.K. Kunhalikutty alleges ‘unholy haste’ by ECI in conducting SIR in Kerala
content: IUML raises various issues, including death of Kannur booth level officer allegedly due to work pressure, as reasons for seeking a halt to SIR in Supreme Court

title: FIR against person who created fake Karnataka government circular announcing holiday following death of Saalumarada Thimmakka
content: The fake notification was fabricated using digital photoshop tools and circulated on WhatsApp groups to spread misinformation and misguide people

title: Kannur BLO’s death linked to work pressure, claims panchayat president
content: Kankol-Alappadamba panchayat president M.V. Sunil Kumar says Aneesh George was under ‘extreme pressure’ adding that he repeatedly told superiors he ‘was unable to cope with the responsibilities assigned’

title: Man in Bengaluru duped of ₹1.15 lakh with promise of taxi under government scheme by fraudster posing as ‘BBMP official’
content: According to the complainant, the accused approached him on phone on October 18, introduced himself ‘Punith Gowda, Revenue Officer from the welfare department of the BBMP’

title: Supreme Court judgment makes Uttarakhand liable to restore, repair Corbett Tiger Reserve
content: Supreme Court orders Uttarakhand to restore the Corbett Tiger Reserve after illegal tree-felling, mandating demolition of unauthorised structures and a restoration plan within months

title: Delhi Police summons Al-Falah University chairman in terror module, fake documents probes
content: “Both regulatory bodies flagged 'major irregularities' after reviewing the University's accreditation claims and submitted their findings to law enforcement agencies,” says Officials

title: X Corp challenges legality of ‘Sahyog’ portal takedown process before Karnataka HC
content: X argued that Section 79 of the Information Technology Act, 2000, is merely a 'safe harbour' clause shielding intermediaries from liability and does not empower the government to direct content blocking.

title: "Biryani", "Daawat": Codes Used By White Collar Terror Module On Telegram
content: The members of the white collar terror module that the security agencies busted in Haryanas Faridabad used the secure messaging app Telegram to make terror plans using the names of common dishes to avoid drawing attention, sources said.

title: 18 Members Of Hyderabad Family - 3 Generations - Killed In Saudi Bus Crash
content: Asif identified some of his relatives as Naseeruddin (70), his wife Akhter Begum (62), son Salauddin (42), daughters Amina (44), Rizwana (38), and Shabana (40), and their children.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Sees Google Unleashing $1 Trillion Boom In Andhra
content: N Chandrababu Naidu is looking to build from the ground up, after the bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh in 2014 siphoned off Hyderabad  one of Indias wealthiest cities  into what is now the neighboring state of Telangana.

title: As Cracks Appear In Lalu Yadav's Clan, A Look At Other Political Family Feuds
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal's massive defeat in the 2025 Bihar Assembly election exposed what was perhaps already known - an unprecedented feud within Lalu Prasad Yadav's family.

title: Saudi Arabia Bus Accident LIVE Updates: 45 Indians Feared Dead In Saudi Arabia After Bus Accident, PM Modi, Vice President Express Condolences
content: Saudi Arabia Accident Live: Tragedy struck near Medina, Saudi Arabia on Monday where 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims are dead following a devastating collision between a bus and a tanker.

title: 'Officially Dead' UP Woman's 3 Year Ordeal To Restore Her Identity
content: For 3 years now, 58-year-old Saroj Devi has been 'dead', at least according to official records. During this time, the woman, very much alive, ran from pillar to post to get the clerical error rectified, only to meet "official apathy", she claimed.

title: From Surviving Massacre To Death Sentence, Sheikh Hasina's 50-Year Journey
content: Fifteen months after her ouster, Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been convicted of crimes against humanity

title: Terror Accused Arrested From Delhi Helped Suicide Bomber In Making Explosives
content: Amir Rashid Ali, the terror accused who helped a suicide bomber plan and carry out the November 10 attack near Delhis Red Fort, played a key role in preparing the explosives that killed 13, according to court papers that NDTV has seen.

title: Al Falah University Chancellor's Brother Arrested In 25-Year-Old Fraud Case
content: The brother of the chancellor of Al Falah University, linked to the Delhi blast probe, has been arrested by the Madhya Pradesh police from Hyderabad in connection with nearly 25-year-old fraud cases, officials said on Monday.

title: Kerala Booth Officers Boycott SIR Work After Colleague Dies By Suicide
content: The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Kerala was affected across the state on Monday as booth-level officers (BLOs) boycotted work following the suicide of an officer allegedly due to work strain.

title: Opinion: Opinion | INDIA Bloc Is Running Out Of Patience With Congress. Can You Blame Them?
content: Like pollution in Delhi, Indian National Congresss continuous downfall seems insurmountable: no solution is in sight, nor is any effort being made to find a way out.

title: Exports Plunge 11.8% in October, Trade Deficit Soars To $41.68 Billion
content: India's exports contracted 11.8 per cent to USD 34.38 billion in October, according to government data released on Monday.

title: J&K Dry Fruit Seller Dies Day After Setting Himself On Fire Over Terror Probe
content: A dry fruit seller from Jammu and Kashmir's Qazigund, who had set himself on fire after police questioning related to the ongoing terror module investigation, has died during treatment at a Srinagar hospital.

title: Sheikh Hasina Gets Death Penalty, Dhaka Court Cites "Crimes Against Humanity"
content: Hasina, 78, is currently living in exile in India, after defying the tribunal's orders to face trial for ordering a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising on August 5, 2024.

title: "Didn't Work In 1971, Won't Now": Sheikh Hasina Aide Calls Trial "Scripted"
content: The former minister claimed that through the trial, which he claimed was scripted, the Yunus government was "creating narrative and drama to show to the world."

title: No Ban On Construction In Delhi, Supreme Court Says "No Temporary Solutions"
content: The Supreme Court refused a blanket ban on construction in Delhi and the National Capital Region amid 'very poor' AQI.

title: Sheikh Hasina Gets Death Penalty: Global Leaders Who Faced The Same Fate
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death by the nation's International Crimes Tribunal for "crimes against humanity" linked to last year's student-led protests that toppled her Awami League government.

title: Dhaka Courtroom Erupts In Claps, Cheers As Sheikh Hasina Gets Death Penalty
content: Sheikh Hasina, 78, was sentenced to death for 'crimes against humanity' committed during last year's anti-government agitation that led to the fall of her Awami League government.

title: Sheikh Hasina Verdict Live: "Biased, Politically Motivated," Says Sheikh Hasina On Death Penalty
content: The former Bangladesh PM was found guilty of ordering a deadly crackdown on student-led protests last year.

title: Amur Falcons Begin Journey From Manipur To Africa, IAS Officer Posts Video
content: At least three GPS-tagged Amur falcons were among thousands of birds embarking on their marathon annual migration journey from India to Africa.

title: Death toll in stone quarry collapse in Uttar Pradesh climbs to six
content: "One body was recovered in the night. The deceased was identified as Indrajit (30), a resident of Panari, Obra. The other two bodies have not been identified and efforts are on to identify them," says District Magistrate

title: Mumbai CNG pumps see rush after gas pipeline damage disrupts supply
content: In a statement, MGL said the disruption occurred owing to third-party damage to GAIL's main gas supply pipeline inside the RCF compound

title: Titan Intech signs MoU to invest ₹250 crore in Andhra Pradesh
content: Project will be developed on a 20-acre industrial site within an electronics manufacturing cluster; investment expected to create 200 direct jobs and over 300 indirect jobs

title: Supreme Court seeks Sahara’s response on amicus submission of 34 claims to properties SICCL wants to sell to Adani Properties
content: The Supreme Court of India has given the Sahara Group four weeks to respond to objections regarding its proposed property sale to Adani, amid ongoing legal scrutiny over its asset liquidation

title: India to showcase defence prowess at Dubai Air Show 2025 from November 17
content: The India Pavilion at the show will feature stalls from HAL, DRDO, Corel Technologies, Dantal Hydraulics, Image Synergy Ekxplor, SFO Technologies

title: Bengal Governor to lead search operation at Raj Bhavan for “arms” post TMC MP's allegations
content: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee accused C.V. Ananda Bose of "sheltering BJP criminals" inside the Raj Bhavan and "arming them with bombs and guns"

title: Saudi Umrah bus tragedy: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy asks CS, DGP to coordinate with Indian Embassy
content: Telangana Government has set up a control room at the Secretariat to assist families of those affected by the accident. The helpline numbers are: 79979 59754 and 99129 19545

title: Indian oil companies secure their first ever deal to import U.S. LPG into India
content: Mr. Puri informed that this would be the “first structured contract of U.S. LPG for the Indian market”.

title: Umrah tragedy: Asaduddin Owaisi seeks MEA’s immediate intervention
content: Asaduddin Owaisi said he has spoken to officials of the Ministry of External Affairs including the Deputy Chief of Mission Abu Mathen George to provide necessary assistance

title: Syndicate member asks V-C to cancel seminar on Bhagavad Gita on Kuvempu University campus
content: He stated that, according to his understanding, the Bhagavad Gita justified the Chaturvarna system, which divides people and is contrary to the fundamental ideals of the Constitution of India

title: Saudi Arabia bus crash LIVE: Hyderabad families shattered as 45 pilgrims die; Last rites to be conducted in Saudi
content: After spending a week in Mecca, the pilgrims were heading to Medina when their bus collided with a diesel tanker in the early hours of Monday

title: Kerala local body polls: A decade of turmoil and defections for Koothattukulam municipality
content: Koothattukulam has had six different chairpersons, including two in the just-concluded term, in the 10 years since it was elevated to a municipality. All three fronts are busy finalising their candidates, hoping to bring in some stability

title: SC hearing on Delhi air pollution: Supreme Court mandates combined action on stubble burning; directs Punjab and Haryana compliance with CAQM orders
content: ‘No knee-jerk reaction’ to pollution, says ASG; Court agrees on no short-term solution; matter posted for further hearing on November 19

title: Kerala local body polls: RMP strives to retain Left party tag remaining as UDF ‘associate’
content: Party is planning to field its candidates in more seats in the 2025 local body polls. Political rivals say the number of grama panchayat members belonging to the RMP has been declining in its birthplace, Onchiyam

title: Kerala local body polls: NCP factions seek to reinvent their roles in State
content: After the recent split, NCP-SP remains with the LDF; but the NCP, a constituent of the NDA in Maharashtra, is knocking on every door except that of the BJP. In 2021, the unified party notched up a modest 0.99% vote share and the  factions are unsure how much of that will follow them into the polling booths this time

title: Kerala local body polls: JD(S), RJD to have a say in LDF prospects
content: These parties ability to influence close contests makes their position more than just symbolic for the broader Left alliance.  As the elections approach, how CPI(M) manages the demands of smaller allies will be critical to maintaining coalition unity and will be key factors to watch for the LDF’s electoral prospects in the 2026 Assembly polls as well

title: An uncertain solar-powered future
content: In the wake of India’s rapid push towards clean energy, upcoming solar power projects along the West Bengal-Jharkhand border have stirred up protests by thousands in both States. Moyurie Som reports on those who believe it’ll lead to an erasure of their livelihoods and access to their primary source of nutrition — fishing

title: Vellore Corporation lays concrete carriageway without relocating electrical poles
content: Tangedco officials said that relocation of electrical poles is done based on the total number of consumers, who would be affected due to power cuts and the type of transmission power lines such as High Tension (HT) and Low Tension (LT).

title: PMK to hold protests against T.N. govt. over caste census issue
content: The party’s senior leaders said the constituency in charges have been asked to ensure a certain number of PMK cadres are arrested in every police station in their constituency.

title: Anna’s speech still relevant about Delhi rulers, says Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin, who spent more than two hours at the Progressive Book Fair organised by the party’s youth wing leader and Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin in Chennai, said he admired Anna’s speeches.

title: Red Fort blast: agencies to recreate ‘bomber’s’ route, probing hawala trail
content: Umar ul Nabi spent ₹3 lakh on fertilizer purchases, say investigators; police tracking owners, drivers of vehicles that were parked near his car; details of Kashmiri students in Haryana, Meerut sought to check if the accused was in touch with them

title: Govt promised to replace stones with laptops, but Kashmiri youth pushed to become suicide bomber: Mehbooba
content: Ms. Mufti urges Kashmiri youth to shun the path of violence and destruction; calls on Centre to rethink its policies, revisit former PM Atal Behari Vajpayee’s roadmap for Kashmir

title: Preliminary probe into BLO’s death finds no evidence of work pressure: Collector
content: During a review of his responsibilities in the Special Intensive Revision process, officials noted that George had distributed most enumeration forms and showed no signs of work-related pressure.

title: Jaishankar to meet Russian counterpart Lavrov to discuss bilateral ties
content: The External Affairs Minister will lead the Indian delegation at the meeting of Council of Prime Ministers of the SCO on November 18

title: DMK government failed to retain investments coming to T.N., alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: He says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin must recognise that the State government’s “inefficiency” has resulted in the loss of 20,000 direct employment opportunities that were intended for the State’s youth

title: Son allegedly held for questioning, man attempts self-immolation in Kashmir
content: Bilal Ahmad Wani, a dry fruit seller by profession, was rushed to the Government Medical College, Anantnag after suffering “severe burn injuries”, officials said; the doctors said he was “responding to the treatment”

title: Karnataka Chief Minister’s visit to Delhi on October 17 kindles hope among Cabinet aspirants
content: Amid talk over a Cabinet reshuffle in Karnataka, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is likely to meet All India Congress Committee president Mallikarjun Kharge in Delhi on Monday to discuss the ministerial reshuffle

title: Hyderabad Metro Rail Phase-II hits a wall of clearances, turns into a waiting game
content: Phase-II unable to move forward with key committees yet to meet and vital documents pending; Centre’s approvals, funding clarity and a proper detailed project report are still missing

title: Media with its objectivity and fairness should be a partner in nation-building: Vice President Radhakrishnan
content: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy termed the Ramoji Film City as the fourth wonder of Hyderabad and said that the State government would extend all support to sustain the legacy of the “Ramoji” brand in various sectors, mainly journalism and the promotion of the state-of-the-art Ramoji Film City, which has emerged as the hub of film-making in the world

title: Alleged suicide of “disenchanted” workers dog BJP in run-up to local body polls in Kerala
content: RSS worker ends life citing denial of ticket for local body polls, while a councillor in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation dies by suicide after a cooperative society incurred heavy debt. A Mahila Morcha leader allegedly attempted suicide accusing the RSS of derailing her electoral chances by ‘orchestrating’ a smear campaign

title: EAM Jaishankar meets Qatar’s top leadership, discusses bilateral ties, global issues
content: “Reviewed key aspects of our Strategic Partnership including energy, trade, investment and people to people connect. Appreciate the exchange of views on Middle East/West Asia, regional and global developments,” S. Jaishankar said.

title: 98% of supply restored, claims KWA a week after tank collapse in Kochi
content: The drinking water supply to 30% of areas within the Kochi Corporation and nearby local bodies was affected after the sidewall of one of the chambers of the twin-chambered storage tank of the KWA collapsed

title: Trinamool accuses BJP of ‘anti-Bengali mindset’ over remarks on Raja Ram Mohan Roy
content: Comments by BJP leaders on Bengal and its icons have repeatedly sparked controversy, giving the Trinamool Congress a platform to accuse the party of being ‘anti-Bengali’

title: Joint team to be formed to monitor STPs in Bengaluru
content: Though KSPCB has been conducting inspections and imposing fines on erring high-rise buildings and apartment complexes in Bengaluru, many are not complying with the rules

title: Trade AD? Wait for free agency? Tank? Every option in Dallas
content: the mavericks are near the bottom of the Western Conference standings . former general manager Nico Harrison sent face of the franchise to the los Angeles Lakers in arguably the most shocking trade in NBA history . meanwhile, Kyrie Irving remains sidelined as he recovers from an ACL tear suffered late last season .

title: ☔ 'Game blouses': Bears' jab at Vikes tops trolls
content: the Chicago Bears defeated the Minnesota Vikings 19-17 . the Bears now have five games-winning drives in the fourth quarter . they are tied for the most in a season by a Bears quarterback since the 1970 merger .

title: Antonio Brown's journey from All-Pro to criminal defendant
content: former all-pro wide receiver faces up to 30 years in prison . he pleaded not guilty last week and is scheduled for arraignment Monday . the 37-year-old's attorney and the prosecutor raised doubts about the alleged victim's claim that a bullet fired by Bronx was fired .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if there was an award for free agent prediction most to likely come true, Josh Naylor returning to the Seattle Mariners would have been the front-runner .

title: Ex-QB Kosar says he will receive liver transplant
content: the former university of Miami and Cleveland Browns quarterback is scheduled to receive a liver transplant . the 61-year-old has undergone five procedures to stop internal bleeding . he was diagnosed with cirrhosis of the liver and Parkinson's disease in 2023 .

title: NFL Week 11's fashionable arrivals, featuring Eagles WR DeVonta Smith
content: pregame tunnel outfits matched the energy of the matchups . varsity and leather jackets show up alongside lighter layers, hoodies, graphic tees and lighter layers . from lowkey tunnel walks to full-on runway moments, week 11 offers a complete style showcase .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: The SEC offered a dose of playoff football in Week 12
content: the 2025 season has been more bluster than reality . the balance of power seems to sway like an LSU fan after a 12-hour tailgate . it's the perfect showcase for this heart-pounding reality, with a team's fortunes waning .
